ch.epfl.alpano

Class PanoramaComputerMultithread

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.epfl.alpano.PanoramaComputerMultithread
  • Deprecated. 
    Since Alapano 1.0. This class is deprecated because of the inefficiencies of how multithreaing was done. Replaced PanoramaComputerExecutionPool

    @Deprecated
public final class PanoramaComputerMultithread
extends java.lang.Object
    This is a class that is used to calculate all the fields of a panorama. This class will use multiple threads to calcualte the panorama.
    Author:
    Jeremy (261178)

      • PanoramaComputerMultithread

    • Method Detail

      • computePanorama

        public Panorama computePanorama(PanoramaParameters parameters)
        Deprecated. 
        Calculates the slope, distance, elevation, slope, longitude, latitude for each sample (pixel).

        For large panorama this method can take some time to complete since it is very computationally demanding.

        This methode manages the thredas that are doing the computation.

        Parameters:
        parameters - The parameters of the panorama.
        Returns:
        The panorama with all the fields filled in accordingly to the data provided by the dem.

      • rayToGroundDistance

        public static java.util.function.DoubleUnaryOperator rayToGroundDistance(ElevationProfile profile,
                                                                         double ray0,
                                                                         double raySlope)
        Deprecated. 
        Represents the distance between the ground and the ray.

        The mathematical formula used to calculate the distance between the ground and the ray takes into account atmospheric retraction. The atmospheric refraction has for effect of making visible objects that wouldn't normally be visible. It also takes into account that the earth is round.

        Parameters:
        profile - Elevation profile of the ground
        ray0 - Initial altitude of the ray.
        raySlope - The tangent of the slope of the ray.
        Returns:
        The distance between the elevation profile and the ray for a given x.
